Posts.Content: Aug 26, 2014 08:33PM NoRecon wrote: I had a bilateral mastectomy ten months ago today.  I came back from it faster then I ever thought possible.  I was using only tylenol by day three post op.  There was nothing wrong with my right breast but I didn't want to live in fear.  I also wanted to go thru surgery once.  It hasn't been as difficult as I thought it would be to live without breasts.  I find peace of mind that I am pain free and I have regained range of motion.  I feel unencumbered without breasts.  A part of me will always be a little sad about it but only a little.  I'm whole and I'm beautiful without breasts.  I couldn't give breast cancer five more minutes of my life then what was needed to save my life.  Good luck to you.  Please remember you are so much more than your breasts.
